title: hilariousandco
author: hilariousandco
content: LOCAL RULE: This thread is for members of the Prediction Pool only. Any other posts will be removed. You can sign up to the pool here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5419161.0

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Great to have a different topic as the other one is overrun by people playing the fantasy game which I am not a fan and also not part of but I am happily a member of the traditional pool and can't wait for this to start.This will be a short event and the prizes although not yet completely clarified are looking good in the Games and Rounds thread.I don't think we will have many surprises as the groups are pretty straight forward for the big teams to win their games but I don't exclude surprises.I love a saying which one of coaches in the local soccer Championship here says,that he is managing the best team and when he draws or loses he comes up with a great argument which is "We can't win always because also the others know to play football".

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: With the embattled Ronaldo of Manchester, can this lad take Portugal all the way despite being out of form, or will it be the super trio of PSG ( Mbapper for France, Neymar for Brazil, or Messi for Argentina) that will take their respective countries all the way ?? For all I know, this Worldcup is going to any of these four big names based on their teams' firepower. But not to get ahead of myself, a few teams that will  be on my watchlist are Senegal, Spain, and Belgium all seem to have that spark and wont go down without a fight but fingers crossed let's hope my teams come through

comments.author: slaman29
comments.body: Nice to see a new thread too, I was getting a bit confused actually with all the stuff going on. Superbru's not working for me right now I went in to check how many participants we had and couldn't see, does anyone know yet how many?Quote from: swogerino on November 15, 2022, 07:13:51 AMQuote from: Woodie on November 15, 2022, 12:19:04 AMWith the embattled Ronaldo of Manchester, can this lad take Portugal all the way despite being out of formRonaldo cannot do anything alone,if Portugal team have a lot of quality players that may help Ronaldo anything can happen because Ronaldo is going to give his 110% as it is his last World Cup and most probably soon after he will quit football because of his age which should be 38 in February.Ronaldo is not embattled, he took the battle on himself, and has lost the respect of so many people. I never liked him to begin with, but I at least had a lot of respect, now I'm only respecting his abilities, I think he has given football such a terrible reputation now from neutral sports observers.Remember Ronaldo no longer carries his team, he wants the team to carry him. He would have helped carry Portugal on for sure but they cannot keep thinking they can win things with him in that kind of attitude. And I bet secretly they also don't want this anymore. Even Portuguese clubs have not offered to take Ronaldo back, what does it say?

comments.author: cryptofrka
comments.body: Only a week more to go!I honestly felt I'd be more excited, I hope I'll be once it starts.Our team is in good form and is traveling to Qatar in a good mood, I'm fairly confident before our 1st game against Morocco.The problem is that in the knockouts we are immediately paired with group E, which means that there's a 95% chance we play either Germany or Spain in the 1st knockout round.

comments.author: Harkorede
comments.body: Quote from: bullrun2020bro on November 17, 2022, 01:57:29 PMEven though Christopher Nkunku has unfortunately been injured at short notice, the French squad is still nominally the strongest (IMHO). Just look at the strikers. It doesn't get much better than this:Karim Benzema (Real Madrid), Kingsley Coman (Bayern München), Ousmane Dembele (FC Barcelona), Olivier Giroud (AC Mailand), Antoine Griezmann (Atletico Madrid) and ofc Kylian Mbappe (Paris St. Germain)I think having this much of strikers might be to their own detriment, just saying though, because It could only remind me of Argentina some years ago, when they seemingly have the best strikers combination going into any tournament, but their midfield was quite a disaster and it ended up causing more harm to the team at large, I meant when Argentina were heading into those tournaments with forward lines consisting of Aguero, Higuain, Tevez, Messi, Di Maria, Diego Milito, Javier Pastore and Martin Palermo.I guess we'll see how it all unfolds, it's just around the corner.
